author: @anikasmith8361
text: I had a friend back in the day who got pregnant and her boyfriend put her through a month of hell. Told everyone she was trying to trap him, probably not his, the usual. After one particularly bad fight, she decided to abort. He was MIA during this time (rumoured to be dating someone new) which was fine with her. Fast forward to after the abortion, word reached him and this fool went ballistic! All of a sudden Mr. MIA had to see her NOW! We, her friends, took turns housing her till she could make the trip to her grandmother's. He was supposed to be so upset that he got drunk and hit someone's car. She moved on but years later, his flip/flop mindset on her pregnancy only makes sense in that HE didn't want to be a parent but he definately wanted HER to be one.

author: @marleymescudi
text: Some men absolutely try to get women pregnant to "keep" them. I've had an ex admit to trying that with me when I was 17/18 and another admit to trying when I was 19. a whole TEENAGER. Both were fully aware of my severe depression, uncontrolled borderline personality disorder, and weekly drug use. Yet still decided to actively try impregnating me. I'm 28 now and it's insane to think about. I'm a regular middle-class girl from Georgia, if someone would try doing it to me I absolutely believe it's happening to more affluent and better-looking women than me. My life would have genuinely been ruined to have a child at that point in my life. It's not a compliment, it's scary.

replies.author: @TheErikaShow
replies.text:
@charlieb1976It is ETERNALLY annoying, af. For anyone who wants to talk about friggin‚Äô birth control‚Ä¶understand this‚Ä¶they made a birth control pill for men during the pandemic‚Ä¶and WHY might you ask did it never go to market? It gave the men headaches‚Ä¶.

Yup‚Ä¶.that‚Äôs it. Cardi may have some kids and a baby daddy (because you CANNOT turn a 304 into husband‚Ä¶.no matter how big that wedding is. These knee-grows have a whole team roster of baby-mamas‚Ä¶

Birth control can be very dangerous for women. It gives us cancer, I have seen women‚Äôs HAIR FALL OUT‚Ä¶.my birth control made me INSANELY DEPRESSED, and my mother (a sonographer for 30 years plus) was NOT a proponent of birth control pills, shots, all of that. I ended up having fibroids from the age of 24‚Ä¶all the way into my 40‚Äôs‚Ä¶and it made my life HELLL‚Ä¶3 surgeries‚Ä¶.one that almost killed me because Black women are NOT safe in hospitals! 

But I never became a ‚Äúbaby mama‚Äù, right? So nobody can talk shit? I can‚Äôt stand this conversation. Why is all of the birth control responsibility on us, when all of that stuff is bad for our bodies? A man who KNOWS that he is a 304 should get a damn vasectomy like a grown up. Dudes and their ü•öüçÜü•ö  are a menace. If Cardi wasn‚Äôt famous, she would be stuck with that idiot, and I am pretty sure he would be a thousand times worse. Offset was out there spreading diseases, and coming home to his pregnant wife with a dirty üçÜ‚Ä¶.so even if she stayed her ass home, her v-jay would still think she was in them streets‚Ä¶.because Offset is a medical hazard. Societies where women are SAFE are the most successful. Why people want to keep blaming women‚Ä¶.is beyond me. Cognitive dissonance at its best.

- "I'm an Ike Turner fan when it comes to that!"

- "That's disrespectful to him, ger, and the baby!"

- "Bruh, you ain't here about the dude who's girl slept around on him while she was pregnant? They both came out the baby's biological fathers. That same thing happened to me!"

- "You just wanna be a female activist! Y'all tryna support all this femininity or whatever you call it."

... It was a quiet haircut after that üò¢üòÖ.
